criterion: Reward for comprehensive inclusion of all clinically relevant points from the transcript, ensuring every major patient and clinician statement is documented without omission

Reward for precise and faithful documentation of patient-reported information (missed glipizide dose, higher blood sugar readings, travel circumstances, reminder methods) using exact wording or clear paraphrase

Reward for accurate capture of clinician counseling and recommendations (importance of consistent dosing, explanation of glipizide action, inquiry about travel system, phone alarms, pill-organizer suggestion) without embellishment or loss of meaning
Reward for incorporating only pertinent chart data that directly support the encounter (Type 2 diabetes diagnosis and current medications) while excluding unrelated chart details
Penalize for omission of any major transcript element or clinically relevant point, resulting in an incomplete or misleading documentation

Penalize for fabrication, inference, or addition of information—including assessments, plans, orders, medication changes, diagnoses, or follow-up—that is not explicitly stated or reasonably implied by the transcript or chart
Penalize for incorrect, altered, or bulk-copied chart information (wrong medication names or doses, unrelated conditions, demographic errors) or selective copying that introduces irrelevance
Penalize for factual errors, misattribution of speaker statements, or other distortions of the conversation such as overstating the number of missed doses or misrepresenting clinician recommendations
